Full description: The site or type of the tumour diagnosed. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
The time period the cancers were diagnosed in. Often a single year but could be a quarter / month / rolling years
The tumour type determined by site, morphology and/or behaviour. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
A sub-division of tumour type determined by site, morphology and/or behaviour. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
A sub-division of tumour type 2 determined by site, morphology and/or behaviour. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
The basis of diagnosis that the registry has recorded for the tumour, eg a clinical diagnosis or a histologically confirmed diagnosis
The stage of the cancer at diagnosis
A sub-division of stage determined by size, invasion and/or spread. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
A sub-division of stage detail determined by size, invasion and/or spread. Further information in the site-specific tumour grouping document
The age of the patient at the time of diagnosis of their cancer
The geographical location where the patient lived when diagnosed with cancer. Often an NHS region but could be a CCG / statistical region etc
The sex of the patient
The grade of the cancer at diagnosis
The nodal status of the cancer at diagnosis
The number of new tumours diagnosed, in a defined cohort (during a fixed period of time, for a certain region, of a given age and sex)
The total number of person-years in a defined cohort (during a fixed period of time, for a certain region, of a given age and sex)

The incidence divided by the population, adjusted for the time period incidence was measured over, and multiplied by 100,000, to give the number of new tumours you would expect in a population of 100,000 people in a year
The lower limit of the 95% confidence interval around the incidence rate
The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval around the incidence rate
